title: Comparative Analysis and Application Strategies of Flipped Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and foundational language learning knowledge
context.additional_context: A language education program operating in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, requiring a balance between interactivity and flexibility in flipped learning design

learning_goals: Learners can complete project-based language tasks with over 80% completion rate in blended flipped learning environments (face-to-face and online)
Learners can explain three or more criteria for selecting environments that consider interactivity and flexibility when designing flipped learning
By incorporating formative assessment feedback, learners can revise individual learning strategies twice or more and improve learning efficiency by 15% or higher

resources: Mobile App with Voice Recording Functionality
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
